skill.name: deeptools
skill.description: NGS analysis toolkit. BAM to bigWig conversion, QC (correlation, PCA, fingerprints), heatmaps/profiles (TSS, peaks), for ChIP-seq, RNA-seq, ATAC-seq visualization.
skill.summary: NGS analysis toolkit. BAM to bigWig conversion, QC (correlation, PCA, fingerprints), heatmaps/profil...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate bioinformatics skill for the deepTools NGS analysis suite. All 519 static findings are false positives caused by the scanner misinterpreting markdown documentation, SAM file format references, and checksum patterns as security threats. The two Python scripts perform only local file validation and workflow generation with no network access, data exfiltration, or command injection risks.

content.value_statement: Process next-generation sequencing data for ChIP-seq, RNA-seq, and ATAC-seq experiments. Convert BAM files to normalized coverage tracks and generate publication-quality visualizations including heatmaps, correlation plots, and profile graphs.
actual_capabilities: Convert BAM alignments to normalized bigWig coverage tracks
Generate quality control plots (correlation, PCA, fingerprints)
Create heatmaps and profile plots around genomic features
Compare samples with log2 ratio and correlation analysis
Validate BAM, bigWig, and BED file formats
Generate workflow scripts for common NGS analysis pipelines
limitations: Does not perform read alignment or peak calling (requires aligned BAM files)
Does not analyze raw sequencing reads (requires prior processing)
Requires samtools for BAM indexing and some operations
Memory intensive for large genomes and whole-genome analyses

use_cases.title: QC for ChIP-seq experiments

best_practices: Always validate BAM files with indices (.bai) before analysis
Use RPGC normalization with correct effective genome size for your organism
Extend reads to fragment length for ChIP-seq but NOT for RNA-seq
anti_patterns: Using --extendReads for RNA-seq (spans splice junctions incorrectly)
Comparing samples with different normalization methods
Running whole-genome analysis without testing on small regions first

faq.question: What file formats does this skill support?
faq.answer: BAM (aligned reads), bigWig (coverage tracks), and BED (genomic regions). Files must be indexed.

faq.question: Do I need to install deepTools first?
faq.answer: Yes, install with 'uv pip install deeptools'. The skill provides commands but requires the deepTools suite installed.

faq.question: What normalization method should I use?
faq.answer: RPGC for ChIP-seq/ATAC-seq, CPM for RNA-seq bins, RPKM for gene-level RNA-seq. See references/normalization_methods.md.

faq.question: Can I process single-end reads?
faq.answer: Yes, but use --extendReads to define fragment length. For paired-end, fragment length is calculated automatically.

faq.question: How do I choose effective genome size?
faq.answer: Use organism-specific values: human=2913022398, mouse=2652783500, fly=142573017. See references/effective_genome_sizes.md.

faq.question: Does this skill call external tools?
faq.answer: It generates commands for deepTools and suggests samtools for indexing. Both must be installed separately.
